segments.content: The newsletter now enters **summer mode: 1 edition out of 2**. I hope you enjoy your vacations 😎.
segments.sourceMdx: The newsletter now enters **summer mode: 1 edition out of 2**. I hope you enjoy your vacations 😎.
segments.translated_content: 本简报即日起进入**夏季模式：每两周一期**。祝各位假期愉快 😎。

segments.content: We will **launch Docusaurus 2.0** very soon ([2.0-rc.1](https://twitter.com/docusaurus/status/1547616687117070338?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter) published). I will send you a special edition for the occasion. It will be the occasion to present you better this project I work on since 2+ years with Facebook. Docusaurus 2.0 is not the most famous React framework, but it remains [**very used**](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1549083893822885888?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter) despite being in beta: twice as much as Remix or Redwood, and is progressively catching up with Gatsby. I hope I can count on you for the **ProductHunt launch** 😄.

I hope I can count on you for the **ProductHunt launch** 😄.
segments.translated_content: 我们将很快发布**Docusaurus 2.0**正式版（已发布[2.0-rc.1](https://twitter.com/docusaurus/status/1547616687117070338?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)）。届时我会发送特别版专题介绍。借此机会向大家详细展示这个我与Facebook团队持续开发两年多的项目。Docusaurus 2.0虽非最热门的React框架，但即使处于测试阶段仍保持[**高使用率**](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1549083893822885888?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)：用户量是Remix或Redwood的两倍，并逐步追赶Gatsby。期待各位支持我们的**ProductHunt发布** 😄。

segments.content: This week, I want to highlight [tRPC](https://github.com/trpc/trpc?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter) to make remote calls (client/server or even server/server). Typical end-to-end solution, agile, and much easier to use than GraphQL. There is no particular event related to the lib, except a significant gain in popularity thanks to Theo and his [create-t3-app](https://github.com/t3-oss/create-t3-app?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter) framework.

segments.translated_content: 本周重点推荐远程调用方案[tRPC](https://github.com/trpc/trpc?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)（支持客户端/服务端及服务端间通信）。作为典型的端到端解决方案，它比GraphQL更轻量敏捷。该库近期虽无重大更新，但得益于Theo的[create-t3-app](https://github.com/t3-oss/create-t3-app?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)框架推动，人气显著攀升。

segments.content: See you soon for the Docusaurus launch 👋.

segments.content: Alex reads the React source code and comments on several parts, taking as an entry point the mount of a React application. Interesting details about the use of prototypes, JSX, and the interaction of the (agnostic) reconciler with the DOM renderer.

segments.translated_content: Alex通过React应用挂载的切入点，逐层剖析React源码并注解。揭示了原型链运用、JSX转换机制，以及（平台无关的）协调器与DOM渲染器交互等技术细节。

segments.content: Amy argues that React hooks do not respect SOLID architecture principles. I don't really agree, but recognize that most of the examples found on the internet are simplified and don't necessarily highlight a good architecture.

segments.content: Almost a direct answer to the above article, even if the application of SOLID is more widely covered here (components + hooks). Note: don't hesitate to use the React context for dependency injection.

segments.content:
* 📜 [Avoid anonymous components with displayName](https://julesblom.com/writing/component-displayname?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): sometimes React can't infer a good name for your components, which complicates the use of devtools (Context, memo, forwardRef, HOC)
* 📜 [Why Remix is not a React framework but a full stack web framework](https://andre-landgraf.dev/blog/2022-07-16_why_remix_is_not_a_react_framework_but_a_full_stack_web_framework/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): a well-written overview of the differences between Remix and other frameworks. Remix is full-stack and framework-agnostic.
* 📜 [Functional programming is finally going mainstream](https://github.com/readme/featured/functional-programming?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): GitHub highlights the popularization of functional programming, in part thanks to React, Redux and hooks. I personally switched career from Scala to React after reading David Nolen's famous post. Didn't even like JS before 2014 😅
* 📜 [Why Docusaurus is a powerful documentation framework](https://blog.1password.com/docusaurus-documentation-framework/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): 1Password explains why Docusaurus is a good solution for their developer documentation portal. Touch various advanced topics, including site customizations, remark plugins to extend MDX/Markdown...
* 📜 [Store data in a cookie with sessions and Remix](https://jonmeyers.io/blog/store-data-in-a-cookie-with-sessions-and-remix?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): creation of a visit counter cookie

segments.content: [**Hermes as the Default**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2022/07/08/hermes-as-the-default?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
segments.sourceMdx: [**Hermes as the Default**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2022/07/08/hermes-as-the-default?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
segments.translated_content: [**Hermes成为默认引擎**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2022/07/08/hermes-as-the-default?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.content: The JS Hermes engine is an alternative to JSC/V8. It can help your app to start faster via a pre-compilation in bytecode. With React-Native 0.70 (now in [release candidate](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.70.0-rc.0?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React\&utm_medium=email\&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)), Hermes is enabled by default. Michael shares various benchmarks from the open-source app Mattermost. The Hermes distribution mode has changed to avoid ABI incompatibility issues. Missing Intl APIs have been added on iOS. Upcoming support for BigInt and WeakRef.
segments.sourceMdx: The JS Hermes engine is an alternative to JSC/V8. It can help your app to start faster via a pre-compilation in bytecode. With React-Native 0.70 (now in [release candidate](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.70.0-rc.0?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)), Hermes is enabled by default. Michael shares various benchmarks from the open-source app Mattermost. The Hermes distribution mode has changed to avoid ABI incompatibility issues. Missing Intl APIs have been added on iOS. Upcoming support for BigInt and WeakRef.
segments.translated_content: Hermes JS引擎是JSC/V8的替代方案，通过预编译字节码可加速应用启动。随着React-Native 0.70（现已发布[候选版本](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.70.0-rc.0?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)）的推出，Hermes已默认启用。Michael分享了开源应用Mattermost的多项基准测试。Hermes分发模式已调整以避免ABI兼容性问题。iOS平台新增了缺失的Intl API支持。即将支持BigInt和WeakRef。

segments.translated_content: Vite 迅速成为前端生态的标杆工具。如今，它是 Create-React-App 的优质替代方案，提供更快的开发体验，并被多个 React 元框架采用（如 Storybook、Hydrogen 等）。v3 版本带来大量变更：全新文档、多框架启动模板（含 React）、全局导入优化等。另可关注十月举办的 [ViteConf](https://viteconf.org/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter) 大会。
